intro: Cyrtandra × waipioensis, commonly known as the Waipio hybrid, is a hybrid plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal forests and wetlands. Due to its limited distribution and unique genetic makeup, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
